subject: Communication
title: Emotional Contagion in Crowds
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Emotional Contagion in Crowds.

hook.text: Ever noticed how one person laughing makes a whole room laugh? Emotions are literally contagious.

buildup.text: Psychologists call it emotional contagion â€” we unconsciously mimic the emotions of those around us.

discovery.text: Mirror neurons fire when we observe someone's expression, making us feel what they appear to feel.

twist.text: A speaker's emotional state infects the room. If you're nervous, they feel it. Excited? They catch it.

climax.text: Great speakers don't just convey information â€” they transmit emotional states to hundreds at once.

punchline.text: Your audience will feel what you feel first.

quiz.question: What causes emotional contagion in audiences?
